organization.name: Justice Forward Alliance
organization.mission: Advance policy reform that dismantles systemic barriers and centers the voices of directly affected communities.

environment.content: The current political landscape offers narrow but real windows for policy reform at the state and local level.
Public opinion on our core issues has shifted favorably over the past five years, but awareness gaps remain.
Institutional barriers including lobbying by well-funded opposition groups are the primary obstacles to reform.
environment.source: Opposition research and legislative vote analysis

environment.content: Grassroots power and coalition breadth are more durable drivers of change than insider access alone.
environment.source: Movement history case studies and campaign evaluations

capabilities.content: We have a proven ability to mobilize 5,000+ constituent contacts on priority legislation within 48 hours.
capabilities.source: Action alert response rates from past campaigns

capabilities.content: Our policy team produces research that is cited by legislators and media outlets.
capabilities.source: Media mentions and legislative testimony invitations

capabilities.content: Our coalition includes 30+ allied organizations across four states.

values.content: Center the voices and leadership of directly affected communities in all advocacy.
Evidence-based policy positions grounded in rigorous research and lived experience.
Nonpartisan approach: we advocate for policies, not parties or candidates.
Intersectional analysis that connects our issues to broader systems of oppression.
Transparency in funding sources and organizational positions.

mission_targets.content: Pass two priority bills at the state level within the current legislative session.
Grow grassroots base to 25,000 active supporters.
Generate 100+ earned media placements per year.

active_strategies.content: Build power mapping database to identify key decision-makers and influence pathways for priority legislation.
Develop community spokesperson training program to amplify directly affected voices in media and testimony.
Create rapid-response communications infrastructure for breaking policy developments.

campaigns.content: State-level campaign for housing justice legislation: tenant protections and affordable housing funding.
Public education campaign on criminal justice reform with focus on diversion programs.
Coalition sign-on letter for federal funding equity in infrastructure spending.

grants.content: Apply for civic engagement foundation grant to support grassroots organizing.
Renew policy research funding from justice-focused family foundation.

principles.equity_mandate: All policy positions are evaluated through a racial and economic equity lens. We do not advance policies that benefit some communities at the expense of others.
principles.data_sovereignty: Supporter data is used only for advocacy purposes. We never share supporter lists with political parties, candidates, or commercial entities.
principles.community_accountability: Policy priorities are set through an annual community assembly. Affected communities have veto power over positions that directly impact them.

custom.name: Centering affected communities
custom.description: People most impacted by an issue lead our advocacy on that issue. Nothing about us without us.

custom.name: Nonpartisan integrity
custom.description: We never endorse candidates, contribute to campaigns, or coordinate with political parties. We advocate for policies.

custom.name: Evidence-based positions
custom.description: All policy positions must be supported by research, data, and/or documented lived experience. We correct errors publicly.

custom.name: No astroturfing
custom.description: All grassroots actions represent genuine supporter sentiment. We never fabricate or inflate constituent support.

custom.name: Coalition integrity
custom.description: We do not claim coalition support without explicit partner consent. We credit partners publicly.
